name: sfchronicle
text:
California blazes exploding: New evacuations from Zogg Fire in Shasta County, North Complex fires in Butte and Plumas counties.

Story by @TrishaThadani: https://t.co/BqU6YXB8u6

name: sfchronicle
text: Wildfires blazed on both the east and west sides of St. Helena, engulfing at least one Napa Valley winery and forcing evacuations as flames raced over rolling hills toward Santa Rosa. https://t.co/IWUNxUD0jQ

name: sfchronicle
text: Flames fueled by fast winds and extremely dry conditions were simultaneously threatening parts of Sonoma and Napa counties, plus the Butte County town of Paradise. https://t.co/Gbvi4jaAMa

name: sfchronicle
text: Authorities issued a series of evacuation warnings and orders, as the fast-moving Shady and Glass Fires spread in Wine Country and the North Complex fire in the northern Sierra Nevada foothills blows up. https://t.co/Gbvi4jaAMa

name: sfchronicle
text: In Sonoma County, flames forced mandatory evacuations for several neighborhoods on the east edge of Santa Rosa, including the 4,500-resident Oakmont senior community, along with surrounding areas along Highway 12. https://t.co/Gbvi4jaAMa

name: sfchronicle
text: The Glass Fire, which began Sunday morning in the Deer Park area and grew to 2,500 acres, threatened thousands of structures along the east side of the Silverado Trail and prompted evacuations. https://t.co/Gbvi4jaAMa

name: sfchronicle
text: In Shasta County, the new, fast-spreading Zogg Fire burned 7,000 acres by Sunday evening, prompting evacuations. https://t.co/1FgA4c97ot

name: sfchronicle
text: High winds and low humidity also intensified the August Complex Fire, which has been burning in several counties near Mendocino County since Aug. 16. https://t.co/1FgA4c97ot

name: sfchronicle
text: The North Complex fire in Plumas and Butte counties has burned 305,881 acres and is 78% contained.  https://t.co/1FgA4c97ot

name: sfchronicle
text: Officials expand evacuations east of Santa Rosa, instructing more people to flee. Evacuation orders now in place for Kenwood and beyond on both sides of Hwy 12, bounded by Bennett Valley Rd in the south and Nelligan Rd and Nuns Canyon Rd in the east. https://t.co/HZ9Bh8FwqO

name: sfchronicle
text: 14,000 Santa Rosa PG&E customers lose power: PG&E said 14,241 homes and businesses it serves in Santa Rosa have lost power, likely because of the fire spreading in the area. At least 3,000 customers in Napa County have no power because of the Glass Fire. https://t.co/yDNkQmtvbJ
